net.mwav.framework

Class SecurityLib

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.mwav.framework.SecurityLib

  • public class SecurityLib
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding cryption.

    In order to create SecurityLib object, the application calls getInstance() method.

    Since AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding cryption requires 128bits(16byte) length of key and iv,

    cryption methods call convertToSpec(byte[]) internally to prevent IllegalBlockSizeException.

    The encryptToString(String, String, String) and decryptToString(String, String, String) return BASE64 encoded result of cryption.

    Order of encryption :

    1. get byte array of text
    2. encrypt to AES128
    3. encode encrypted text to BASE64
    4. convert to String
    Order of decryption :
    1. get byte array of text
    2. decode encrypted result to BASE64
    3. decrypt
    4. convert to String
     
 SecurityLib securityLib = SecurityLib.getInstance();
 String encrypted = securityLib.encryptToString("key", "iv", "password");
 String decrypted = securityLib.decryptToString("key", "iv", encrypted);
 //"password".equals(decrypted) may return true
    Since:
    1.0.1
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    (정) 남동희
    See Also:
    Cipher, IvParameterSpec, SecretKeySpec

      • getInstance

      • convertToSpec

        public byte[] convertToSpec(byte[] input)
                     throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Converts the input to byte array and copies it truncating or padding with zeros.

        If the length is greater than 16, truncates until 16th index.

        If not, pads with zeros. 

         
 String shortKey = "mwav.net";
 String adjustedShortKey = new String(convertToSpec(shortKey));// "mwav.net        "
 
 String longKey = "abcdefghijklmnopqrs";
 String adjustedLongKey = new String(convertToSpec(longKey));// "abcdefghijklmnop"
        Parameters:
        input - the input
        Returns:
        Returns the byte array of size 16
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if The Character Encoding is not supported
        See Also:
        Arrays.copyOf(byte[], int)

      • convertToSpec

        public byte[] convertToSpec(java.lang.String input)
                     throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Converts the input to byte array and copies it truncating or padding with zeros.

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt(byte[] key,
                      byte[] iv,
                      java.lang.String text)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Encrypt the text to AES128 with given key and iv.

        Calls convertToSpec(byte[]) before encryption.

        Parameters:
        key - the key
        iv - the initial vector
        text - the text to encrypt
        Returns:
        Returns the byte array of encrypted text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the key or iv are invalid

                                        java.lang.String text)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception

        iv - the initial vector
        text - the text to encrypt

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(byte[] key,
                      byte[] iv,
                      java.lang.String text)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Decrypt the text to AES128 with given key and iv.

        Calls convertToSpec(byte[]) and decode the text to BASE64 before decryption.

        Parameters:
        key - the key
        iv - the initial vector
        text - the text to decrypt
        Returns:
        Returns the byte array of decrypted text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the key or iv are invalid

      • decryptToString

        public java.lang.String decryptToString(java.lang.String key,
                                        java.lang.String iv,
                                        java.lang.String text)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception

        iv - the initial vector
